MAPI doesn't allow non-office apps to prompt for modern auth. You gotta open the profile with Outlook first to cache creds. If you're trying to bypass cache and go online, then you need to open Outlook with an online profile to cache those creds.
Reminders aren't distinct objects - they're just props on a meeting. So you don't delete the reminder - you change the props that the reminder search folder is looking for.
Whatever file youre trying to open is already open in another app. Process explorer can tell you who has it open.
Sorry. This app is built on mapi, which is part of Outlook for Windows. Its impossible to port to Mac. Maybe you could use the graph api?

@stephenegriffin :  Thanks for the feedback - [is this where I should start](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/) for info on graph api? 

And if I might trouble you with one other question: What is it that your program does that recovers lost folders? I know that's a dumb question, but I'm still shocked and astounded that Outlook for Mac can "lose" 40-50 of my folders, yet MS has no solution for that.

I don't know the specifics of your issue. Perhaps the folders have somehow been moved to a location not normally visible in the client, in which case the resolution would be to move them back. Or else maybe they have been marked as hidden, in which case the resolution would be to remove the properties marking them as hidden.

Do you know what happened to lead to the folders being lost?

No - I don't know how this happened. It's not my machine, but belongs to a friend & I'm trying to help. I helped her search, but I couldn't find them either. She has said she is certain that she did not delete the folders. And that seems likely to me because it was 15-20 folders missing, but 3 remain! 

After failing in my search, I contacted M'soft's Exchange support (I have an account). The tech support guy mentioned the word "corrupted" referring I think to the database for mail. He was very nice, but in the end, he said they (MS Tech Support) couldn't "recover" the missing/lost/misplaced/hidden folders without `mfcmapi`, and that meant she had to have a Windows machine. Neither of us use Windows any longer, so this is a bit of a roadblock at the moment. 

I find it incredible that MS has no method to resolve these corruption issues for macOS... but then this isn't the first time I've been surprised :) 

Any advice or suggestions will be much appreciated.

I shared this with a Mac EE. Their comments:

> My guess (based on the limited details) is that the folders were not syncd with Exchange and at some point were deleted.
>
> You should be using Time machine or a similar database backup tool to ensure you dont lose data.  Time machine is the best IMO.
>
>BTW, if the customer is fairly savvy AND the physical files are still on desk, the customer can navigate the low level structure with MySQL.  Generally speaking its rare that the files are still on desk. Outlook 2011 did have a way of restoring database files.
>   https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/rebuild-the-office-database-c21643be-0f0d-4997-9ec1-8044080054b0
>
>Heres an article about the 2016+ version of the database which does silent rebuilds.
>  https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/about-the-office-for-mac-database-62dd4473-5a7d-407b-b384-1d5f767e8b4b

The Time Machine idea is a very good one! She uses Time Machine, and it's set on "autopilot" - will definitely look into this. 

I've also read the article re the 2016+ version. It implies that Microsoft denies the existence of any database problems. Not helpful, and one reason I'm not a MS customer any longer. Oh... wait - I am - I still use MS Outlook :)  Anyway - it just doesn't seem that helpful as it suggests something we've already done, and MS says your software is the only salvation. 

But I do sincerely appreciate your help with this - many thanks!

Great!

looking forward to updated release. Meanwhile I have created a workaround which replaces the troublesome characters with valid equivalents and pass them to MrMapi:

```
setlocal enableDelayedExpansion
::Obtain .msg files from store by Entry ID (which can be found with MFCMAPI) @13 is inbox
MrMAPI.exe -Contents -Profile Outlook -Folder "#0000000038A1BB100....A0000000000\@13\In Bearbeitung AK\abzulegen" -Ms

::Delete CONTENTS_TABLE.xml und FOLDER_PROPS.xml'
del Folder_Props.xml CONTENTS_TABLE.xml '

:: replace long ID's in filename by running number, should subject of several messages be the same 
set /a "runnumber=0"
:neustart
ren *_00000* *_%runnumber%.*
if errorlevel 1 set /a runnumber = runnumber+1 & goto neustart

:: Replace special character by valid equivalents
set string1=
set string2=ue
for %%F in (*%string1%*.msg) do (
  set "filename=%%F"
  ren "!filename!" "!filename:%string1%=%string2%!"
)

set string1=
set string2=oe
for %%F in (*%string1%*.msg) do (
  set "filename=%%F"
  ren "!filename!" "!filename:%string1%=%string2%!"
)

set string1=
set string2=ae
for %%F in (*%string1%*.msg) do (
  set "filename=%%F"
  ren "!filename!" "!filename:%string1%=%string2%!"
)

set string1=
set string2=ss
for %%F in (*%string1%*.msg) do (
  set "filename=%%F"
  ren "!filename!" "!filename:%string1%=%string2%!"
)

set string1=
set string2=Ue
for %%F in (*%string1%*.msg) do (
  set "filename=%%F"
  ren "!filename!" "!filename:%string1%=%string2%!"
)

set string1=
set string2=Oe
for %%F in (*%string1%*.msg) do (
  set "filename=%%F"
  ren "!filename!" "!filename:%string1%=%string2%!"
)

set string1=
set string2=Ae
for %%F in (*%string1%*.msg) do (
  set "filename=%%F"
  ren "!filename!" "!filename:%string1%=%string2%!"
)

::convert all .msg files into .eml (with passing AddressBook
for %%f in (*.msg) do MrMAPI.exe -MIME -Input "%%f" -Output "%%f.eml" -Ad

::delete all .msg files
del *.msg

::remove .msg prior to .eml file extension
set string1=.msg.eml
set string2=.eml
for %%F in (*%string1%*) do (
  set "filename=%%F"
  ren "!filename!" "!filename:%string1%=%string2%!"
)
```

groups are stored in the NST which needs a special entry ID (not documented) to access
In Mapi you dont just open a pst. Instead you add the pst to the profile, then you open the profile and the pst is there. Mfcmapi already supports this. Look in the menus in the profile.

Alright. Resolved the last LoadLibrary (caused by OutlookServicing.dll).

**Workaround**: The following should set up the environment correctly to get MFCMAPI to load (at least for x86):
```
set PATH=C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Office\root\Office16;C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Office\root\vfs\ProgramFilesCommonX86\Microsoft Shared\OFFICE16;%PATH%
```
Love the effort here to get it to run. This is a known bug (OC 4121989) in this version of Outlook. A fix is on the way.

I used the Windows UI to set the environment variables for x64 Office and this also worked. Thanks @robliao 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42624521/80407697-a5b29f80-888b-11ea-92f1-9312d9bf3e8e.png)

Also, loading 
%ProgramFiles%\Microsoft Office\root\vfs\ProgramFilesCommonX86\Microsoft Shared\OFFICE16\Mso20win32client.dll 
and 
%ProgramFiles%\Microsoft Office\root\Office16\OutlookServicing.dll 
prior to calling MAPIInitialize() gets rid of the crash.

Not sure if this issue was ever solved, but I discovered a solution:
1) Open the associated contents table of the destination "Inbox" for the new auto complete data
2) DO NOT DELETE the existing IPM.Configuration.AutoComplete message (note the ConversationID referenced)
3) Proceed with Folder -> Import of the new auto complete MSG
4) Refresh the View and you will have two (2) IPM.Configuration.AutoComplete (now with different Conversation ID)
5) select the "old" IPM.Configuration.AutoComplete records, right click and Open Message; find each Property with a value of IPM.Congifuration.AutoComplete and delete the property.  If a property fails to delete, skip and proceed to next step.
6) Close the message and select the "new" IPM.Configuration.Autocomplete record and Open Message; find each Property with a value of IPM.Configuration.AutoComplete; righ click and Copy Property.
7) Close the message and re-open the "old" from step 5.  Right click and paste the property.  Repeat for each property in step 6.
8) from Step 5, if a property failed to delete, find the identical property name within the "new" message, right click - Edit Property and copy the Binary string.
9) Close the message and re-open the identical Property in the "old" message record, right click to Edit the property and paste the binary data.
10) Restart Outlook and the auto complete should now work.  It worked for me.  :)

Root cause looks more like this: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/9410681/setwindowtextw-in-an-ansi-project

I think the cause of the  problem in https://stackoverflow.com/questions/9410681/setwindowtextw-in-an-ansi-project is different.
When the non-ascii character turns to ?, it is caused passing wrong codepage to WideCharToMultiByte.

But the problem I've reported, MBCS characters are split two SBCS characters.

For example, the character code of "" is 0x8366 in Codepage 932 (Shift-JIS, the default codepage of Japanese), and it should be 0x30c7 in Unicode.
But stringTowstring handles the MBCS character as multiple SBCS characters, and just change the type from byte to word.
So the character "" becomes 0x0083 () and 0x0066 (f) in Unicode.

This may be OK in US-ASCII world, but it's NG in other language.

Yes - I'm familiar with the  round trip problem in conversion of MB text. That's why I overhauled the UI to keep strings Unicode native as much as possible even in the ascii builds.

However, the functions you identified aren't on the code path for setting or drawing the title here, so touching them won't fix the problem. The problem was exactly as identified in the SO article. Temp swapping in DefWindowProcW for Unicode handling of the message allows us to set the Unicode string without a round trip through ascii. Same trick in the drawing code allows us to get the native Unicode string without another round trip through ascii. So we can stay Unicode native all the way through.

Do let me know if you see any other scenarios where the UI shows ? for unicode characters. I can't fix PR_*_A strings - that conversion happens down in the MAPI layer. But I *can* ensure the rest of the UI uses _W props for data and avoids round trips through ascii.

Most of the ANSI texts are handled LPCSTRToWstring, and this function does similar thing.
And stringTowstring is used to convert PR_DISPLAY_NAME_A to unicode when display title of main dialog in ContentsTableListCtrl.cpp.

I've already confirmed that the code change fixes the problem in Japanese environment.

Something to try - delete the system created archive folder, then move your folder to the location of the system one. Make sure it's a move and not a copy. That way, any cached entry IDs pointing at your folder will still work.

AbortSubmit is for messages in the submit state

Right. The read receipts are in a submit state and the SMTP host only accepts 500 relays a day. So when I converted the POP account to IMAP and marked all the emails as read(because the were all showing as unread suddenly) OUTLOOK attempted to send read receipts out and I am trying to use MFCMAPI to delete them from OUTLOOK sending them out.

The error comes from the store provider youre working with (possibly proxied from the transport provider). If you havent already, pull your network tap and/or turn off WiFi.  Then restart Outlook. Then, maybe, the provider will let you abort the submission.  You might try this both with outlook running and with outlook shut down.

If youre still failing, Id double check that the messages are actually in the submit state. If theyre not you might just be able to delete them.

[PR_MESSAGE_FLAGS](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc839733(v=office.15).aspx) is a computed property. It can be altered without calling SaveChanges. For instance, you can toggle read/unread status with [SetReadFlag](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/office/cc815395.aspx).

If you want to watch for changes to a message, you should be using notifications and/or [Incremental Change Synchonization (ICS)](https://blogs.msdn.microsoft.com/stephen_griffin/2008/01/31/where-did-i-put-those-5-5-sdk-docs/).

> It can be altered without calling SaveChanges.

https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/office/cc815395.aspx
> The IMessage::SetReadFlag method sets or clears the message's MSGFLAG_READ flag in the PR_MESSAGE_FLAGS property and calls IMAPIProp::SaveChanges to save the message. 

thus it contradicts the statement

> From then on the provider should update PR_LAST_MODIFICATION_TIME during every IMAPIProp::SaveChanges call.



But thanks a lot for the keyword ICS!

But both technologies are intended for runtime. My intention, however, is to detected changes between two executions of my programm. I am looking for a easy and **fast** (very important) way to detect changes on items since last run of my program. I see, unfortunately a simple compare of PR_LAST_MODIFICATION_TIME is not enough. What about PidTagChangeKey?

- PR_MESSAGE_FLAGS
- ?

The address book doesn't support named properties (I suppose some third party AB could, but none of ours do). They use properties over 8000 directly, without any mapping. You can recognize this when you see properties starting with PR_EMS_AB, as you do in this case.

BTW, when MFCMAPI knows it's dealing with an AB entry, it stops doing GetNamesFromIDs and does prop tag mapping instead. However, there are some scenarios where MFCMAPI can end up with an item and not know that it's an AB item. Some of these scenarios are bugs in MFCMAPI since I *could* have known, but some are unavoidable. The scenario you outlined appears to be working correctly.
Thanks

You've got Outlook2 2016 ClickToRun - those interfaces aren't exposed in C2R.

Hard delete isn't supported by every store implementation. MFCMAPI does allow you to attempt things that stores will refuse to do. This is not a bug in MFCMAPI.

`\\?\` is a [prefix used in Windows](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa365247(v=vs.85).aspx) to allow longer paths, DOS reserved names (e.g. AUX, CON), and other things.

You should be able to open the files with this prefix without issue. In most cases, it's even desired.

@eesheesh I know what this prefix is for. But in this case it's completely undesired. Because may programs rely on PST full path. But the main issue is not the \\\\?\\ prefix. The main issue is that you can't use SUBSTed and Network Mapped drives now for some reason: it just resolves them to original location and this is the major issue.
I doubt this is MFCMAPI's doing - have you tried to repro in Outlook?

As I said before, in Outlook everything is ok. So, if I open the PST in Outlook using File -> Open -> Open Outlook Data File then I get correct paths.
By the way, this issue can be easily reproduced on all Outlook 2016 (latest versions) including Office 365.

I still suspect this is an Outlook issue - they've been messing with PST paths recently. You're testing with 1702 - do you repro with other branches? Most notably, do you repro with Insider Fast or Slow?
Both with latest Office 2016 (not Office 365) and Office 365 Insider Fast.

I've confirmed with the dev that the change that caused this was backed out. Lemme know if you still repro after the next Insider Fast update.

BTW - as part of this work, dev did discover some older network storage devices really don't work right and caused [GetFinalPathNameByHandle](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa364962(v=vs.85).aspx) to fail. Net effect is PSTs can't work on those devices. However, since we never supported PST on a network anyway, we're not really worried about that. :)

All MAPI can do is ask that an operation be performed. It's up to the server (or perhaps the PST) to perform the operation. So this isn't a bug in MFCMAPI. 6. Choose a folder to export to and wait.

Answers to the above questions by Tanay Sir:-

---About college placements---
    Find placements outside. People are looking to hire. But they are doing skill based hiring. Show them that you can build           
    software and you'll get in.

     Conventional placements happen on potential. If you don't get the chance to play that game, then play the game of 
     showcasing your skillset.
     jobChallenge was just one idea. No one's stopping you from building a kick-ass portfolio, write blogs, write essays.
   - Do open source.
   - Give talks.
   - Collaborate with peers.
   - Help seniors build projects.
   - Learn to network. 
   - Read programming books and post your summaries. 
   - Be bullish about your Growth. 
   - Everyday go on Discord/Twitter and show your work to the world. 
   - Talk about your progress, your learning.
   - Learn programming. 
   - Learn git. 
   - Learn cloud. 
   World is not looking to hire newbies, what can you do? STOP BEING A NEWBIE. 
 
   And all of this looks hard. You feel OMG, it's easier said than done. But this is how I learnt. Nobody told me what to do, I saw    
   what other people were doing and did that. I know this sounds brutal, but hey! you want to win this tide, it's not gonna be easy.
   Frame this answer.

   
   
---What to do if you don't go to college---

  If you don't want to go to college, don't go to college. But then build your basics.

  Learn about Networking. Write your own webserver. Publish on Github (POG). Publish a Blog (POB). 
 
  Learn about Databases. Write your own database. POG, POB.

  Learn about Software Design. UML Diagrams, Agile. POB. 

  Learn about Algorithms. Publish your own implementations as a library. POG, POB, PoNPM. 

  Learn about programming language. Build your own compiler. PoG, PoB.

  Understand system design. Read blogs from big companies. Write your own understanding. PoB. 

  Learn about Operating Sytems. Try to write your own small OS. Learn linux. 
  POG. Agressively PoB. 

  Learn some math as well. Algebra, Vectors, Matrix, Statistics, probability, graphs. This will serve you well in any field. 

  Learn about Artificial Intelligence. Write your linear regression algorithm. Don't be a script kiddie and run sklearn models. POG,     
 POB. 

 Obviously do all the other things I told in the previous answer. 
 Be complete engineer with the basics and the skills which market demands.

 Additionally, I don't care about your English. But if you can't write 5 words together to make a sentence then it's going to be really    
 difficult for you making your mark without a degree. Communication is key in this world when you want to make a difference. So,  
 yes, please think about this too.


---How to work on your Tech Portfolio---
  Here's a link to a video to answer this question.

  https://youtu.be/bjrSTyI8-dE

 what all should I learn in tech?
 You can find all the links mentioned in the talk here

 https://gist.github.com/tanaypratap/239299bc628bac07bf2812022b85f2e4

 Do you feel overwhelmed...

Answered by Tanay Sir on Telegram-

CSS is not easy. It's tough because of many reasons.
1. It's verbose. You need to know a lot of keywords to make it work.
2. It's declarative. Which means your normal programming logic doesn't work.
3. There's cascade which you need to understand. A lot of people don't do CSS well because they don't understand cascade well. 
4. There are tons of other concepts like box sizing, position, media query etc. which you need to understand. 

I have read the book CSS the definitive guide and it helped a lot TBH. You can check it out if you're serious about being good in CSS. 

But the struggle goes on, as we as web devs practice CSS less.

You have already jotted down some points @tanaypratap . I hope you'll answer this question today!

Referrals mean something. At least for me. It means I am putting my personal stamp on you. When I refer someone I put in the system what I admire about the person and why he/she would be a good fit. How the team/organization will benefit from his addition into the team. I think that's one of the reason that when I put a referral the candidate is almost always called for interview. Coz my comments show utmost sincerity and honesty.

I can't do that when I don't know the person. So, messaging me and asking me for a referral I feel is not a valid ask. Question is, "Can I not get your referral if we haven't worked together?"
Answer is, "You can! Utilise the community and here's how"

1. Speak in meetups and conferences. I follow a lot of speakers.

2. Write good blogs and share your knowledge. I follow a lot of bloggers.

3. Create something on Github and evangelize it.

4. Participate in discussions on Twitter and LinkedIn.

5. Moderate a telegram group, a subreddit.

6. Start a newsletter. 

Give me a chance to know you better. Let this be organic. In the last 2-3 years of my job at Microsoft I have referred a lot of folks. I love to be the one opening the doors for your next opportunity. But not through DMs, through open collaboration on public platforms.

Otherwise, there's always the option to apply directly on the job opening.

Last thought, someone who refers anyone loses internal value too. If I refer someone I know 100pc he/she will get an interview call. Coz I have made sure that my referrals are good. 

So, beware when someone is referring you without knowing you, coz that too is not gonna help.

Hey Aditya. I checked your GitHub repository and saw you named your HTML file as business.html. Change that to index.html and your web page should work.
Thank u khusharth . It worked  but why it was not working with business.html. Do you have any idea.

Glad to know that :). Index.html is the default name used for the homepage of websites. So whenever someone will type the name of your website (eg www.aditya.com) the web-server (here netlify) will try to find index.html in your folder and return it to the user. 
For more details you can read here https://www.lifewire.com/index-html-page-3466505

What's it that you don't like about React but like about Flutter?

Hey @tanaypratap!

I didn't particularly like React's package management. It breaks so often, and is harder to configure (than Flutter) if you're working on different machines.

Moreover, I did not like the JSX syntax, and I prefer Dart's programmatic approach a lot more.

The only benefit (that I found) in using React was really small app sizes.

If you choose a language/framework based on ease of use (personal preference) than market demand then you'll be less sellable.
For freelancing, do whatever you wanna do. But if you need a job, you need to know what the job asks. 

Anyway, I think if you're programming in any language it's fine. But do cover the basics and be open to learn or work on anything.

Let me first give you a non-software analogy: **Consider Burger king (BK) and Mc-donalds (MD):** Both BK and MD make burgers (for now consider only burgers), but both of them have a different way (framework) of making them and they taste different. BK has its own framework and MD has its own framework for making burgers. Framework controls the way burgers are made. They might use common materials (libraries) such as cheese, buns etc. made by other manufacturing companies or they might even produce their own. You could say a framework is a collection of libraries, but the idea is different. (a library is just another module or function which is exposed to be used outside) Now coming to software framework: Similarly, in software, a framework is a certain way of writing your software not only a piece of code but your entire application. Its solving structural and architectural problems on the code level. For ex: **This is how you render HTML to the DOM using nothing but plain JavaScript.** ` var HelloMessage =
Hello world
` ` document.getElementById("root").innerHTML = HelloMessage` **This is how you render HTML to the DOM using jQuery library.** ` var HelloMessage =
Hello world
` ` $(#root).html(HelloMessage)` See how jQuery simplified the DOM node fetching by its general $(node) syntax, no matter whether its id or class or tag, but it didnt change the way you assign
element. (I know its a very small example for demo :/) **Lets talk in terms of Inversion of control, it will give you a more clear idea.** When you use a library you have the control over your code. Whenever you need something from the library you simply call it. On the other hand, when using a framework, the framework is doing most of the work and there are particular places where you insert your code (for ex: In react you put your html (jsx) inside the render function). Framework usually owns the main function. In case of react `render()` is the main function. So whenever the framework needs the application specific code it calls your code. So here the control is inverted from you to the framework. This is called inversion of control. Conclusion: Library gives you a set of functions/modules/APIs which you can use to solve a certain problem, but it doesnt change your code on the structural or architectural level. On the other hand, frameworks also give you a set of functions/modules/APIs but it does change your code on the structural or architectural level. Library - you call it, Framework - it calls you. Hope this answers your Question!

I would suggest not to go with coaching. In my personal experience I find self study better than going through some coaching because you don't have to keep up with the pace of coaching/tuition. But you have to be systematic with the way you approach you approach competitive questions. Reason I say this is because I have seen people who start by going through difficult question even without know basics and end up frustrated and low because they are not able to solve competitive questions.

1. Start with by learning data structures first. Take one data structure at a time and then go to any competitive site(hackerearth, hackerrank, codechef) of your preference and then start solving questions based on the data structures you have learnt. Most of the sites have question based on data structures.
2. Then go for algorithms and follow same approach.
3. Once you are able to solve all easy levels and few medium level questions, then go for events/competitions online.
4. Participating in time bound event is necessary because it helps you in approach a problem fast which is always the case in interview.

Meteor.js is not used much anymore so, I won't sweat a lot of my time on it if I were you.

The idea of meteorjs was to create a framework which would do realtime fullstack app development. It was built on pieces like handlebars, express etc. and had sockets to do realtime connection to client. I haven't worked on it much but to be honest I didn't like it.

I like the MERN stack today because it gives you control over individual pieces. What meteor wanted to do was revolutionary at its time but I think now the entire team is working on Apollo and riding the graphQL bandwagon.

We won't be doing the web template in a traditional way as we won't be rendering on the server. What we will do is create apps using React. React uses JSX for templating and we'll be covering that in details.

There's a simple benefit there, the entire stack is in Javascript so, it's very easy to learn and make apss and there's enough demand around it.

## Where is the course?
The course has already started at [youtube.com/tanaypratap](youtube.com/tanaypratap) . 
I would advise you to subscribe to it and enable notifications so that you never miss a lesson.

## Order for the Coding part
1. **[Create your profile by learning HTML/CSS](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E8cl_8ktp9M&list=PLzvhQUIpvvug-c-bExl_xFcopeQi_sa29)** This will get your hands dirty with some HTML, CSS and teach you about Github. It will host your first website that too for free!

2. Once, you have created your portfolio, **[go learn vanillaJS](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C_R6dvU4820&list=PLzvhQUIpvvuj9nN70USkHJrrSeQ9aiqdB)**. This course will teach you programming in a fun way by creating your first app. Take time with this course. Read MDN docs as mentioned in the course and try to understand most of what is being taught.


## Other Materials

This is a running course and sometimes I make videos about what students ask in some of the live Instagram AMAs, or at the github AMA repo.

Feel free to go through these  **[AMA videos](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Qz5_ccyusbg&list=PLzvhQUIpvvuhBNrOVqlhRnhDqz8ob6MeW)** as they answer some of the most asked questions about tech industry.

If you're in college, I would strongly recommend you to go through the videos about **[how to make the most out of your college life](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xtU-82K3OBQ&list=PLzvhQUIpvvujXvcaIthycttSLChcP_rF2)**.


If you are new to tech industry, I feel that it's imperative to understand how cloud works as it has been a game changer. Please go through the **[cloud series videos](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jsb40ZFBs_Q&list=PLzvhQUIpvvug_CmlkJlzSce4j-w37p3xd)** to understand it better.

Sometimes, you need a little more push towards making a decision or a little more practice on a particular tech. **[Supplements](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_hVzE9UEacI&list=PLzvhQUIpvvuhpBvp_dmjPizeHLVpMCxYB)** is for that. These videos are there to just binge watch to grow!

You don't have much time to create a portfolio and go for bigger jobs otherwise I would have suggested my course.  I don't give private tuitions, the entire content is on YouTube, please feel free to learn as much as you can.

Understand this, there's no magic wand! Things will take time, if you have the patience to work hard you will do good! Wishing you all the luck!

## Tricks to optimize data usage

In cases where your hosting provider has limited bandwidth, say in Github pages it's 1GB per month. You can optimize your site's data usage by following few tricks

### use cdn

Most of our site these days are libraries. jQuery, Bootstrap etc. should be downloaded from CDN and not from your site's root . 
For better performance, try to use one CDN for all libraries. This will reduce the time to resolve domain for multiple sites.

### optimize images

Images form a major chunk of data transferred on the client. However, sometimes we put images which are huge, say 5MB. But that image can be optimized using [squoosh.app](https://squoosh.app/) and you can save precious bytes over wire.

Understand that this will impact your website positively coz the page will load faster

### always serve minified assets

Use modern build tools to minify your javascript and css

### Images from service providers

Imgur serves as a image service provider. You can upload your image and use that URL to show images. This way, images are not served from your bandwidth.

If you like the tips, press the like button.!! :)

Notes:
Whether you like to believe it or not, what is shown in movies is not the actual work. It's **not that fancy.** Nobody actively attacks you. There **are bots**. And then there are devices on the other sides which fights these bots, called firewall or advanced levels of firewall. 
So, your job is mostly reduced to seeing the logs and alert. Most of this field is **automated** by Cisco and other big players. Therefore, even though the field has a lot of money, most money goes to these big companies.

Other part is that you have to do a lot of mugging up to pass certifications. These exams are extremely costly and needs almost zero creativity. And if you don't have a certification, your value will be zero.

Penetration Testers also mostly use tools, albeit advanced ones. And they have a playbook. Oh! we found this vulnerability, good, let me try to get escalated privileges with this. So, the creativity scope is quite limited.

Social engineering is some aspect but if you work for a company, which you will work for, that engineering will be left to sending phishing emails.

I am not saying that it's a boring field. I am saying that majority of the work is not as fancy as it seems from outside.

The reason I started the vanillaJS course before teaching React is that I feel it's extremely important. There are multiple reasons to it:
* You get better at programming
* There's a whole bunch of people who work on creating libraries only.
* You are not bound to one framework
* Many libraries like Bootstrap are replacing jQuery with vanilla JS
* Important for interview
* You understand JS better and thus the inner workings of any framework
* Sometimes you don't need the bloat of a framework for smaller apps. Makes things faster.
* Right your own framework.

I'll explain these points in a video. Watch out Youtube for that.

I won't be teaching Java or Kotlin in this course. This course is primarily focused on getting students a job, and the demand for web developers is at an all time high.

If you want to develop for mobiles, I would be covering how to do PWAs. You can watch [this video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Qz5_ccyusbg&t=3s) for more context.

I think the solution might be to use something similar to `std::construct_at` from C++20?
https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/memory/construct_at
equivalent to
```
return ::new (const_cast<void*>(static_cast<const volatile void*>(p)))
    T(std::forward<Args>(args)...);
```

There is certainly a value of having both `tl::expected` and `tl::optional` playing together in a team.

I would say the convertions from one another could be added, like:

```
tl::optional<T> opt = some_expected.value_or_none();
```

as well as something along these lines:

```
tl::expected<T,E> exp = some_optional.value_or_err([]()->E{ ... });
```

An example is how this is made in Rust, where there are seamless transitions between the two.
* https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/result/enum.Result.html#method.ok
* https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/option/enum.Option.html#method.ok_or

(for whoever is unfamiliar with Rust, `Optional<T>` there maps to `tl::optional<T>` here, and `Result<T,E>` maps to `tl::expected<T,E>`, in principle)

Having such expressiveness nicely simplifies code and makes it much clearer that workarounds with if/elses.

Some more observations:

- `std::optional` has `operator<` etc. similar to your current implementation. So your code's behaviour is kind of expected, except for the difficulty of comparing orders of errors.
- p0323r3 describes `operator==` and `operator!=`, but not `operator<`, `operator>`, `operator<=`, or `operator>=`.

I think a simple solution may be stick to p0323r3 for comparison operators? We can still define policy-based comparison classes as extensions.
I think you're right that the easiest solution is to stick to p0323r4 and possibly define ordering classes as extensions later.

That's an interesting case. First I thought it's a bug in the constant folding but it's actually by-design. You could argue that it's unfortunate, but it's based on the behavior of `decimal.Equals`. I've rewritten the code below to bypass the constant folding. As you can see, the problem is that `1.23m` and `1.2300m` are considered equal, which is why the constant folder collapsed them into the same value slot.

``` sql
WITH Value AS (
    SELECT 1.23 AS Value
),
RoundedValues AS (
    SELECT ROUND(TO_DECIMAL(Value), 2) TwoDigits,
           ROUND(TO_DECIMAL(TO_STRING(Value) + '00'), 4) FourDigits
    FROM   Value v
)
SELECT  r.TwoDigits,               -- 1.23
        r.FourDigits,              -- 1.2300
        r.TwoDigits = r.FourDigits -- True
FROM    RoundedValues r
```

You can replicate the behavior in C#:

``` c#
const decimal twoDigits = 1.23m;
const decimal fourDigits = 1.2300m;
const bool equals = twoDigits == fourDigits;

Console.WriteLine(twoDigits);               // 1.23
Console.WriteLine(fourDigits);              // 1.2300
Console.WriteLine(twoDigits == fourDigits); // true
Console.WriteLine(equals);                  // true
```

By the way, this behavior doesn't repro in [nquery-vnext](http://github.com/terrajobst/nquery-vnext) because constant folding hasn't been implemented yet. I'm wondering whether adding constant folding is actually a good idea; the value seems to be quite low but it complicates the design of the semantic model quite a bit. Right now I'm thinking that [nquery-vnext](http://github.com/terrajobst/nquery-vnext) will not perform constant folding.

Thanks for taking the time to analyze the issue. Fully agree with your conclusion, because 1.23 is in fact equal to 1.2300 (though not the same thing). Regarding constant folding I also think along the same lines as it seems to cause some other problems as well (e.g. #7).
Fair, although #7 is arguably simply a bug. I'm more concerned with issues like this where the behavior is unfortunate but correct :smile:

The security exception is caused by NQuery because it does not specify the assembly attribute AllowPartiallyTrustedCallers. Unfortunately, just applying this attribute does not solve the actual problem. In order to improve performance of expression evaluation NQuery uses .NET lightweight code generation (LCG) to emit MSIL at runtime. To make this work with websites you will need at least a trust level of "High" (which is not an option at all). 

At the moment I see to possible ways to circumvent this problem:
1. Place NQuery in the global assembly cache (GAC). In this case NQuery will have implicitly full-trust. NQuery will assert the needed permissions to allow you to run your web application with any trust level.
2. If NQuery does not have the permission ReflectionPermissionFlag.ReflectionEmit it is possible to use interpreted expressions. In some scenarios this can be much slower but at least it would work.

Please allow me to ask you a few questions:
1. Is placing NQuery in the GAC an option for you?- How much data needs to be processed by NQuery?
2. Are you using a lot of queries with nested SELECTS etc?

Answering these questions will help me to decide how to support web site scenarios. Thank you.
